data.text:
Philip J. Rivers OBITUARY

FITCHBURG — Philip J. Rivers,79, of 398 Princeton Road, died Sunday in HealthAlliance Hospital/Leominster.

Mr. Rivers was born in Fitchburg, Feb. 12,1928, son of Philip and Helen (Cushing) Rivers. Mr. Rivers attended Fitchburg Public Schools and the former Steven’s Business School.

For 40 years before retirement he worked for Rogers in the Square as a manager.

Mr. Rivers enjoyed gardening, hunting, fishing, hiking, bowling and playing chess.

He was a World War II Navy veteran, serving on the USS Randolph in the North Atlantic and the Mediterranean.

Mr. Rivers’ wife of 54 years, Lucille (Simard) Rivers, died in 2003.

He is survived by a son, Philip J. Rivers Jr., and his wife, Judy, of Westminster; a daughter, Dale Duval of Fitchburg; five grandchildren, Christie Duval of Fitchburg, Douglas Duval Jr. of Winchendon, Jennifer Goguen of Gardner, Stephanie Rivers of Westminster and Philip Rivers III of Westminster; and three great-grandchildren, Matthew Keep, Geena Duval and Deven Duval.

He was predeceased by a sister, Jane Stout, who died in 2005.

RIVERS — A memorial Mass will be held Thursday, May 24 at 10:30 a.m. in St. Joseph Church, 49 Woodland St., Fitchburg. Burial will be in St. Bernard’s Cemetery. There are no calling hours. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the American Heart Assoc. 20 Speen St., Framingham MA 01701 or to the American Lung Assoc., 61 Broadway, New York, NY 10006. Aubuchon-Moorcroft Funeral Home is assisting the family with arrangements.
